headline: How The Narrative Around Ninety One Group (LSE:N91) Is Shifting With JPMorgan’s Latest Targets
summary: Ninety One Group’s story has shifted again, with JPMorgan’s price target moving from £1.90 into the low £2s and most recently to £2.26 while the rating stays Neutral. The latest change is small in headline terms, but it reflects refreshed assumptions on revenue and future cash generation that keep the valuation work current without signalling a major change in conviction. Read on to see what is driving this evolving narrative and how you can keep on top of future updates as they come...

content.title: How The Narrative Around Ninety One Group (LSE:N91) Is Shifting With JPMorgan’s Latest Targets
content.summary: Ninety One Group’s story has shifted again, with JPMorgan’s price target moving from £1.90 into the low £2s and most recently to £2.26 while the rating stays Neutral. The latest change is small in headline terms, but it reflects refreshed assumptions on revenue and future cash generation that keep the valuation work current without signalling a major change in conviction. Read on to see what is driving this evolving narrative and how you can keep on top of future updates as they come...

headline: How Recent Target Cuts Are Reframing The ASOS (LSE:ASC) Investment Story
summary: ASOS has just seen its fair value trimmed slightly from £3.60 to £3.51, feeding into a lower price target of £2.40 that keeps the stock in the Neutral camp. Behind that shift is a reset in revenue growth assumptions, with the model input moving from a previously much higher figure to 35.97%, reflecting more cautious expectations for how quickly the top line may build from here. Investors who wish to monitor how these changing growth assumptions affect the ASOS narrative can follow future...

headline: Trump Says Credit Card Firms Violate Law If Rates Not Capped
summary: Trump, speaking Sunday to reporters on Air Force One as he returned to Washington from Florida, doubled down on his demand that card issuers lower interest rates to 10% and keep them there for one year.  “They really abused the credit cards,” he said of major lenders.

content.title: Trump Says Credit Card Firms Violate Law If Rates Not Capped
content.summary: Trump, speaking Sunday to reporters on Air Force One as he returned to Washington from Florida, doubled down on his demand that card issuers lower interest rates to 10% and keep them there for one year.  “They really abused the credit cards,” he said of major lenders.

headline: Barclays, US Bank Shares Slide as Trump Slams Credit Card Rates
summary: The comments increase the political pressure on a slew of card issuers, including Barclays Plc, JPMorgan Chase & Co., Capital One Financial Corp. and Citigroup Inc. Card interest rates — hovering above 20% in recent years — have become a target of US lawmakers on both sides of the aisle, with bills popping up and meeting stiff resistance from the industry.  In pre-market hours in New York, Capital One plunged 10%, while American Express Co. fell 4.9%.

content.title: Barclays, US Bank Shares Slide as Trump Slams Credit Card Rates
content.summary: The comments increase the political pressure on a slew of card issuers, including Barclays Plc, JPMorgan Chase & Co., Capital One Financial Corp. and Citigroup Inc. Card interest rates — hovering above 20% in recent years — have become a target of US lawmakers on both sides of the aisle, with bills popping up and meeting stiff resistance from the industry.  In pre-market hours in New York, Capital One plunged 10%, while American Express Co. fell 4.9%.

headline: JP Morgan chief to host Reeves at annual Davos summit
summary: Jamie Dimon, the JP Morgan Chase chief, and Rachel Reeves, the chancellor, will jointly host an event at next week's World Economic Forum, two months after the Wall Street behemoth said it would open a vast new office in London in the wake of a budget which exempted the banking sector from punitive tax rises.  Sky News has learnt that Mr Dimon has agreed to introduce the chancellor at a roundtable gathering in Davos, Switzerland, next Thursday, which will be attended by the bosses of some of the world's biggest multinational companies.  The invitation issued by Mr Dimon's office refers to "a unique opportunity to engage with a key policymaker on the UK's current economic landscape, plans for growth and investment, and policy reform".

content.title: JP Morgan chief to host Reeves at annual Davos summit
content.summary: Jamie Dimon, the JP Morgan Chase chief, and Rachel Reeves, the chancellor, will jointly host an event at next week's World Economic Forum, two months after the Wall Street behemoth said it would open a vast new office in London in the wake of a budget which exempted the banking sector from punitive tax rises.  Sky News has learnt that Mr Dimon has agreed to introduce the chancellor at a roundtable gathering in Davos, Switzerland, next Thursday, which will be attended by the bosses of some of the world's biggest multinational companies.  The invitation issued by Mr Dimon's office refers to "a unique opportunity to engage with a key policymaker on the UK's current economic landscape, plans for growth and investment, and policy reform".

content.title: Nuvation Bio Reports Preliminary Fourth Quarter and Full Year 2025 Financial Results and Provides 2026 Outlook Ahead of 44th Annual J.P. Morgan Healthcare Conference
content.summary: NEW YORK, January 12, 2026--Nuvation Bio Inc. (NYSE: NUVB), a global oncology company focused on tackling some of the toughest challenges in cancer treatment, today announced preliminary fourth quarter and full year 2025 net product revenue for IBTROZI® (taletrectinib) and provided a 2026 outlook ahead of its presentation at the 44th Annual J.P. Morgan Healthcare Conference in San Francisco, CA.

headline: What 10% Credit-Card Rate Cap Would Mean for Your Wallet
summary: President Trump’s call for a cap promises to save Americans billions in interest but also can lead to tightened access to credit.
